layer.name: Discipline
layer.definition: Do what needs doing, especially when you don't feel like it.

questions.principle: Morning routines start with evening discipline

answers.5: locked in — same time every day, including weekends
answers.2: loose — I have a vague target but rarely hit it
answers.3: consistent during the week, but weekends throw me off
answers.1: chaotic — I sleep when exhausted and wake when I have to

answers.5: settled — I've built systems that make it automatic
answers.3: good when it's easy, but stress or busyness derails me
answers.1: whatever's convenient — nutrition rarely factors in

questions.text: My hydration and substance intake are ...

answers.5: automatic — hydration is handled and I'm intentional about performance
answers.2: something I think about but don't change
answers.3: managed sometimes, but I easily slip into bad patterns
answers.1: not something I track — I run on caffeine and rarely drink water

questions.principle: Clean your room; environment shapes behavior

answers.4: mostly ordered, with occasional pileups that I address
answers.5: clean and organized — I've built systems that maintain it
answers.2: occasionally cleaned up, but quickly returns to disorder
answers.3: mixed — some areas organized, others perpetual disaster zones

questions.text: My approach to rest and breaks is ...

answers.4: usually appropriate, occasionally pushing too hard before I do
answers.5: scheduled — I've learned my limits and I respect them
answers.2: rare — taking them feels like weakness
answers.3: inconsistent — I often ignore the signs until I crash
answers.1: push until I crash, recover, repeat

remediation.advice: Start with sleep. Everything else becomes harder when you're tired. Set a non-negotiable bedtime for one week. As Brian Tracy says: 'How you start your morning determines the quality of your entire day.' And how you end your evening determines how you start your morning.

scripture.text: It is in vain that you rise up early and go late to rest, eating the bread of anxious toil; for he gives to his beloved sleep.
